description: 100 notes with small-world topology: high clustering (0.3+) with low avg path length (<3.0). Notes form a ring lattice with random rewiring. Tests path length maintenance, clustering preservation, and realistic PKM structure.

notes.title: Daily Note - Jan 6, 2025
notes.content: Worked on the Platform SDK integration with the API Gateway. Had a good pairing session with Ryan Nakamura on TypeScript generics. The Data Team is testing their new ingestion pipeline. Sophie Chen presented the Nova Analytics roadmap at the all-hands. Need to review the Kubernetes upgrade plan from Jake Morrison.

notes.title: Daily Note - Jan 7, 2025
notes.content: Deep dive into the Schema Registry implementation. Ava Kim reviewed the design doc and suggested improvements to the event versioning strategy. Carlos Rivera demoed the new Chart Library components. The ML Team is preparing for the Scoring Model v2 release. PostgreSQL connection pooling needs attention.

notes.title: Daily Note - Jan 8, 2025
notes.content: Sprint planning day. Mei Lin presented the Data Quality Framework roadmap. The Frontend Team is prioritizing accessibility standards compliance. Nina Petrov showed impressive results from the Anomaly Detector. Reviewed Docker image sizes with Jake Morrison. The NovaTech quarterly review is next week.

notes.title: Daily Note - Jan 9, 2025
notes.content: Finished the Caching Layer Redis integration. Alex Okafor helped with the Monitoring Stack configuration for cache metrics. The Berlin office had network issues overnight. Sophie Chen is gathering feedback on the Nova Dashboard UX. Need to update the GraphQL schema for the new endpoints.

notes.title: Daily Note - Jan 10, 2025
notes.content: Friday wrap-up. The CI/CD System deployment went smoothly thanks to the Ops Team. Carlos Rivera merged the Design System dark mode PR. Mei Lin and Nina Petrov are collaborating on the Feature Store integration. Good progress across all teams this sprint.

notes.title: Architecture Review - Jan 2025
notes.content: Monthly architecture review led by Ava Kim. Topics: Platform Architecture evolution, Data Warehouse scaling challenges, Frontend Architecture modernization plan. Ryan Nakamura proposed adopting Kafka for inter-service messaging. Jake Morrison presented the Kubernetes multi-region expansion. Nina Petrov discussed ML Monitoring improvements.

notes.title: Sprint Retrospective - Jan 2025
notes.content: Retrospective for Sprint 23. Went well: Stream Processing latency improvements, Component System new components shipped, Model Registry automation. To improve: cross-team communication on schema changes, test flakiness in the CI/CD System, documentation gaps in the Platform SDK.

notes.title: Data Team Sync - Jan 2025
notes.content: Weekly data team sync. Mei Lin reported the Ingestion Engine handles 15M records daily now. Schema Evolution Strategy is working well with the new versioning approach. The Data Catalog adoption is increasing. Query Optimizer Notes were useful for the team. Alex Okafor joined to discuss ETL Monitoring alerts.

notes.title: System Design Reading Notes
notes.content: Notes from reading about distributed system design patterns. Relevant to the Event Bus architecture and Stream Processing at NovaTech. The saga pattern could improve the Transform Pipeline reliability. Also read about feature store implementations relevant to the ML Platform.

notes.title: ML Paper Reviews
notes.content: Reviewed recent papers on anomaly detection and recommendation systems. The attention mechanism paper is relevant to the NLP Classifier improvements. Nina Petrov recommended the survey on evaluation metrics for ML systems. The Embedding Service could benefit from the new contrastive learning approach.

notes.title: Engineering Onboarding Guide
notes.content: Onboarding guide for new engineers at NovaTech. Day 1: Set up development environment with Docker and Node.js. Day 2: Clone Nova Analytics and explore the Platform SDK. Week 1: Complete TypeScript coding exercise and shadow code reviews. Ryan Nakamura coordinates mentor assignments.

notes.title: Tech Radar Q1 2025
notes.content: Technology radar assessment. Adopt: TypeScript strict mode, Kafka for event streaming. Trial: Bun runtime, effect-ts. Assess: Deno, WebAssembly components. Hold: REST-only APIs. The NovaTech stack centers on TypeScript, React, PostgreSQL, and Kubernetes.

notes.title: Q1 2025 Personal Goals
notes.content: Goals: deepen Kubernetes expertise, contribute to the Recommendation Engine, mentor junior engineers on TypeScript patterns. Maintain daily walks and reading habit. Present at the next architecture review. Learn more about the ML Platform internals from Nina Petrov.

notes.title: Incident Report - Jan 8 Redis Outage
notes.content: Redis cluster experienced failover at 03:14 UTC. Impact: Caching Layer degraded, Rate Limiter fell back to in-memory mode, Batch Scheduler jobs delayed. Root cause: memory pressure from large sorted sets. Jake Morrison led incident response. Resolution: increased memory limits and added eviction policies. The Monitoring Stack caught it quickly.

notes.title: Coffee Spots Near Offices
notes.content: Favorite coffee spots. Austin: Houndstooth, Fleet Coffee. Berlin: The Barn, Five Elephant. Tokyo: Fuglen, Bear Pond. Walking to coffee doubles as the daily break. NovaTech offices all have good coffee machines but the local shops are better for walking meetings.

notes.title: Ava Kim
notes.content: [[Ava Kim]] is the CTO of [[NovaTech]]. She sets technical strategy and oversees [[Platform Team]], [[Data Team]], [[Frontend Team]], [[ML Team]], and [[Ops Team]]. Expert in distributed systems and TypeScript. Based in [[Austin]].

notes.title: Ryan Nakamura
notes.content: [[Ryan Nakamura]] is VP Engineering at [[NovaTech]]. He manages the [[Platform Team]] and coordinates cross-team architecture. Works closely with [[Ava Kim]] on technical direction. Expert in Node.js and Kubernetes.

notes.title: Mei Lin
notes.content: [[Mei Lin]] leads the [[Data Team]] at [[NovaTech]]. She built the [[Ingestion Engine]] and [[Data Quality Framework]]. Expert in PostgreSQL and data pipeline architecture. Based in [[Berlin]].

notes.title: Carlos Rivera
notes.content: [[Carlos Rivera]] leads the [[Frontend Team]] at [[NovaTech]]. He maintains the [[Component System]] and [[Design System]]. Expert in React and TypeScript. Based in [[Austin]].

notes.title: Nina Petrov
notes.content: [[Nina Petrov]] leads the [[ML Team]] at [[NovaTech]]. She developed the [[Scoring Model]] and [[Anomaly Detector]]. Expert in Python and deep learning. Based in [[Berlin]].

notes.title: Jake Morrison
notes.content: [[Jake Morrison]] leads the [[Ops Team]] at [[NovaTech]]. He manages [[Kubernetes Management]] and the [[CI/CD System]]. Expert in Docker and Terraform. Based in [[Austin]].

notes.title: Sophie Chen
notes.content: [[Sophie Chen]] is the Product Manager for [[Nova Analytics]] at [[NovaTech]]. She defines the product roadmap and works with [[Carlos Rivera]] on UX priorities and [[Ava Kim]] on strategy.

notes.title: Alex Okafor
notes.content: [[Alex Okafor]] is a Senior SRE on the [[Ops Team]] at [[NovaTech]]. He maintains the [[Monitoring Stack]] and [[Incident Management]] procedures. Expert in Kubernetes and Prometheus.

notes.title: NovaTech
notes.content: [[NovaTech]] is a technology company building sustainability analytics. Offices in [[Austin]], [[Berlin]], and [[Tokyo]]. Key teams: [[Platform Team]], [[Data Team]], [[Frontend Team]], [[ML Team]], [[Ops Team]]. Flagship product: [[Nova Analytics]].

notes.title: Nova Analytics
notes.content: [[Nova Analytics]] is the flagship product at [[NovaTech]]. The [[Nova Dashboard]] serves as the primary interface. Data flows from the [[Data Warehouse]] through the [[API Gateway]] to the frontend. [[Sophie Chen]] manages the product.
